properties.address: Market Hill
properties.description: Community in a Cup is a monthly, drop-in information hub on the last Tuesday of the month 10am-12pm at Maldon United Reformed Church.   It is a joint project between Longfield Medical Centre and Maldon United Reformed Church (URC) offering help, information, fun and relaxing craft activities, free refreshments, a warm welcome and a listening ear.   There is specialist help and advice available from organisations including Alzheimer’s Society, United in Kind, Ace Music Therapy, Tesco, Community Agents, Essex County Fire & Rescue, Action for Family Carers, Parkinson’s, MacMillan, and U3A.   Dates for 2024 are: - 30 January - 27th February - 26 March - 30 April - 28 May   Come along and find out how to keep well. All are welcome.
properties.title: Maldon Warm Spaces – Community in a Cup

properties.address: 27 Fullbridge
properties.description: A weekly drop-in hub on Tuesdays, 9.30am-1pm at Fullbridge Church, Maldon.   All are welcome. Come along for FREE refreshments and a light lunch.   Get information, advice and support from local organisations including Job Club, Citizen's Advice, and Maldon and District CVS. It also offers support for Ukrainian refugees and their host families.
properties.title: Maldon Warm Spaces – Fullbridge Church Community Hub

properties.address: Highwood, Chelmsford CM1 3QJ, UK
properties.description: Warm Space, Monday to Friday 09.00 - 17.00 Free for everyone. All welcome. Throughout the year, we offer a warm welcome. This Winter, with rising living costs resulting in many people worried about keeping their homes heated, we are offering a Warm Space for everyone in the foyer at Highwood Village Hall. Come along and enjoy refreshments, books and board games, bathe in the warmth of other members of our communities and relax in a warm and comfortable environment. Whether you want to quietly read a book, the papers or knit and natter, families and individuals, young and older, are all most welcome to share our Warm Space this Winter.
properties.title: Highwood Village Hall – Warm Spaces

properties.address: 17 Wantz Rd
properties.description: Elim Church is open to the public for coffee on Wednesdays 9.30am-1pm whilst the food pantry is running.   All are welcome to drop in for a hot drink and a chat.
properties.title: Maldon Warm Spaces – Elim Pentecostal Church

properties.address: 35-37 Moulsham St
properties.description: Stay warm in winter and make sure noone eats alone. Every Tuesday 3pm-5pm, come to Cookes and be a part of the Chelmsford Community. Enjoy a hot meal and drink for just £4 whilst sitting amongst 160 years of heritage. Meet new people and make new friends.
properties.title: Chelmsford Warm Spaces – F Cookes Pie & Mash

properties.address: Colchester Rd, 23 Colchester Rd, Maldon CM9 4AL, UK
properties.description: Heybridge Parish Council provide a drop-in Warm Hub at Plantation Hall to Heybridge residents on weekdays 9am–3pm. The Hub offers warm drinks, soup, warm clothes and coats, toys and a chat to those in need. All are welcome.
properties.title: Heybridge Warm Space

properties.address: Maldon Rd, Great Baddow, Chelmsford CM2 7DW, UK
properties.description: Committee Room 1 at The Parish Hall, 19 Maldon Road, Great Baddow is open to all as a Warm Space on Thursdays 1.30pm to 4pm and Fridays 1.30pm to 4pm. Starting Thursday 12th January 2023. Come along and join us for a chat, refreshments and activities.
properties.title: Great Baddow Parish Council Warm Space

properties.address: Lime Walk, Chelmsford CM2 9NJ, UK
properties.description: Thursday morning 10.30am - 12 noon Our coffee mornings have been running for over three years and are enjoyed by all. A time to have a good chat and there is always lots of laughter. We have a good selection of cakes and biscuits to go with the tea and coffee, or treat yourself to a toasted teacake! We do not make a charge, but donations to cover costs are welcomed. We are always happy to welcome new people of all ages - so why not come along.
properties.title: Thursday Warm Up at Moulsham Lodge Methodist Church

properties.description: Warm Spaces Wednesdays 10am – 12pm. Refreshments provided free of charge. The Reading Rooms, Billericay, CM12 9AS
properties.title: Human Kind – Café

properties.address: Galleywood Rd, Chelmsford CM2 8BS, UK
properties.description: The Little Edi Foundation is an Essex based non-profit where children and young people are at the heart of the organisation. We believe all children should have equal access to education and learning development, enabling them to reach their full potential.
properties.title: Little Edi Foundation

properties.address: Little Waltham, Chelmsford CM3 3FE, UK
properties.description: Abberton Rural Training (ART) are an award winning charity providing rural skills education and training including mental health counselling and advocacy support. We have specialist groups for all types of people including SEND, Wounded and Injured Service Personnel & Veteran, domestic Violence Victims, ethnic minorities & refugees, adults struggling with mental health, NEETS, Youth offenders and general adult groups. We work across Essex with 13 sites available and have short and long term courses and support options. We use nature and the environment as the basis including horticulture, countryside & environment, woodlands, land based studies, construction, carpentry, textiles and rural crafts all using recycled materials. We also work with councils and other partners with community gardens and schools projects. We also provide holiday activities for children in gardening and rural crafts for age 5+ with SEN and FSM.   We are a Warm Space.
properties.title: Abberton Rural Training

properties.address: The Grove Centre, Witham CM8 2YT, UK
properties.description: Based in Witham, Essex we welcome anyone who wishes to join us to pop by to access our various clubs, groups, use our cafe, hire our meeting rooms or sit in our warm spaces. The Witham Hub is the home of the Witham Community Fridge which supports those in food poverty but also prevent good food from going to landfill so is open to all to use Most of our activities are free but if we do charge we keep our costs as low as possible to give everyone the chance to take part All are welcome at the Hub
properties.title: The Witham Hub

properties.address: 17 Centenary Way, Chelmsford CM1, UK
properties.description: Hot drinks, bring a board game, grab a book from the Book Nook   Every Friday from October 21st 2022 onwards the centre's main hall (The Chase) will be open to all between 1 & 5pm. Come to your community drop in. Get to know your neighbourhood or perhaps find a quiet corner with a book for the Book Nook. Grab a cuppa, bring a board game, stay for five minutes or hours - it's up to you. (Room hire and heating being donated by Beaulieu Community Trust in conjunction with the Warm Bank countrywide scheme) We are a Warm Space
properties.title: Beaulieu Community Centre

properties.address: Rettendon Common, Chelmsford CM3 8DP, UK
properties.description: The hall is open on every Wednesday until April, from 11am till 2pm, offering a warm space, company, food and drink free to the Parish of Rettendon which includes the village of Rettendon, Rettendon Common area and Battlesbridge. There are games, books, jigsaws and crafts available. The hall is available for hire at other times and is already used by the Rettendon Horticultural Society, Parish Council, dance classes, bowls and craft groups.
properties.title: Rettendon Memorial Parish Hall

properties.description: Growbaby is an outreach compassion project aimed at ensuring babies and children under 5 in our local communities have everything they need FREE for their early years of life. We recognise that the financial impact of having a baby can be huge and we try to ease the strain for local families by offering all our new/2nd hand items entirely free of charge! Baby clothes, Moses’ baskets, car seats, buggies, emergency nappies & milk are all available.
properties.title: GrowBaby Rayleigh

properties.address: High St, Billericay CM12 9BQ, UK
properties.description: Baby Basics is a volunteer-led project aiming to support new mothers and families who are struggling to meet the financial and practical burden of looking after a new baby. Baby Basics started in Sheffield in the spring of 2009, this centre continues to support families across Sheffield working with a wide range of frontline health and social care professionals. There is an ever increasing network of Baby Basics centres across the country each staffed by a committed team of volunteers. For your nearest Baby Basics please click here. Baby Basics provides much needed essentials and equipment to mothers and families who are unable to provide these items for themselves; including but not limited to teenage mums, people seeking asylum and women fleeing domestic abuse and trafficking.
properties.title: Baby Basics Billericay

properties.address: Springfield Grn, Springfield, Chelmsford CM1 7HS, UK
properties.description: All Saints' Winter Warmer Every Tuesday from 2 to 4 pm - drop in for free tea, coffee and biscuits and a friendly chat, with board games and colouring to do if you like. Everyone is welcome to join us in All Saints' Church Centre in Springfield, Chelmsford. Winter Warmer will run from November 2022 - March 2023.
properties.title: All Saints’ Springfield

There is always tea/coffee and usually a cake. A £1 donation is asked for to cover this. For further information, please contact the church direct.

properties.address: Springfield Park Rd, Chelmsford CM2 6EB, UK
properties.description: There is a free vegetarian meal provided every Thursday at Springfield Baptist Church, Chelmsford at 5.30pm. It's completely free and anyone can come. There's no need to let us know, just turn up. If guests do not want to eat at the church we can provide a takeaway. Tea and coffee is served too. It's a lovely atmosphere and warm too. The food that FoodCycle use is given by local supermarkets. From this a two course meal. is prepared Sometimes there is surplus left over ie: bread and cakes and the guests can take this home. Again, free of charge.
properties.title: FoodCycle (Chelmsford)

properties.description: Our mental health is important! Whether you are a single parent, new to the area or looking to make friends, Caffe Marconi would like to provide a safe, cosy and diverse environment to engage, share and support in our community. *HUGE DEAL* Halwa, Chani or Puri taste or sausage sandwich @ £3.50. Starting every Tuesday from 8th November 10.30am - 12.30pm (term time)
properties.title: Ladies Coffee Morning

properties.address: Tydemans, Great Baddow, Chelmsford CM2 9FH, UK
properties.description: Are you a keen knitter? Or have you always wanted to learn how? We are welcoming volunteers to join a new ladies' only knitting group at Hamptons Sport & Leisure Centre in Great Baddow. The group includes experienced knitters, complete beginners, refugees, older people, and ladies who've dealt with difficult circumstances or sad times. Over lots of coffee and cake we chat, create, laugh, and make things for good causes! Bring your own projects, or join us in making items for local causes. The group meets on the second and fourth Monday of each month, 10am to 12noon.
properties.title: Ladies Knitting Group

properties.address: Boreham, Chelmsford CM3 3EG, UK
properties.description: Open to all women, the Guild meets on the first Wednesday of each month except January and August. The meetings start at 2.30pm and are held in the Pelly Room, which is behind the church. The Women’s Guild was formed in 1974 when the Revd. William Smith realised that back then the Mothers Union only allowed married women who were mothers to join, which seemed unfair. It started with just 10 members, and now has 30 members. The meetings open with a brief prayer, then there is usually a speaker, sometimes serious topics to make us think, and sometimes speakers who just made us laugh. There is also a time to just sit and chat and enjoy tea and biscuits. All women are welcome to attend regardless of their status, in fact Women’s Guild is fully inclusive, we even have men attend occasionally. If you would like more information, please call 01245 463490 or email mannlynn15@gmail.com
properties.title: St. Andrew’s Woman’s Guild
